summary: The 'Building Out Optimized Space Testing for Engines Act' (BOOST for Engines Act) directs the NASA Administrator to continue modernizing rocket propulsion test infrastructure at NASA facilities. This includes enhancing capabilities, safety, and supporting propulsion development for government and commercial space programs. The bill prioritizes investments in projects for large engine testing, commercial access to facilities, and ensures modernization efforts do not negatively impact existing programs. It aims to improve space transportation and exploration capabilities.
